column4: can anyone help with my TFTP server? It doesn't respond to any requests. Using tcpdump I can see the requests being made... I set up the config file, the tftp root directory, and restarted xinetd. Any ideas?
the client just gets "timed out" when i try to get a file
have you looked at the access logs?
no. can you tell me where they are?
you need to look in /var/log/
thanks, i'll look
or you can look at the startup script for tftp and see if the command logs to a certain file. i am not familar with tftp
I think I need to edit my tftp config file to make it log. I'll try that.
what does the startup script say?
it probably needs to be a dir. so it would sudo mkdir
that's what I tried at first, but then I got "/dev/loop0: Is a directory"
which makes me think it's not supposed to be...
that means that the directory is already there
http://paste.ubuntu.com/251144/
that's what I get if I create the directory. No loop created, whether I start with a directory or start with nothing.
why in the world are you trying to use a swap file over nfs?
because I only have 16mb on my embedded device and that's not enough to run apt-get
and cross-compiling is a pain
ah, sorry. i see. so do you have the nfs shared out like the directions to the link you pasted. i have never done this so I am only trying to help from what I read
that's alright, thanks for your help. you indirectly led me to solve my tftp problem earlier, by the way
oh, cool. so what are you going to do about the nfs share as swap?
